member.param: The instance containing the event data.
member.remarks: This method notifies the server control that it should perform actions common to each HTTP request for the page it is associated with, such as setting up a database query. At this stage in the page lifecycle, server controls in the hierarchy are created and initialized, view state is restored, and form controls reflect client-side data. Use the IsPostBack property to determine whether the page is being loaded in response to a client postback, or if it is being loaded and accessed for the first time.

contains one or several overlapping Tokens along with their scores and positions.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Fragmenter
member.summary: Implements the policy for breaking text into multiple fragments for consideration by the {@link Highlighter} class. A sophisticated implementation may do this on the basis of detecting end of sentences in the text.
member.author: mark@searcharea.co.uk

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Fragmenter.IsNewFragment(Lucene.Net.Analysis.Token)
member.summary: Test to see if this token from the stream should be held in a new TextFragment
member.returns: true if [is new fragment] [the specified next token]; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Highlighter
member.author: mark@searcharea.co.uk

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Highlighter.#ctor(Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Scorer)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Highlighter.#ctor(Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Formatter,Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Scorer)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Highlighter.GetBestFragment(Lucene.Net.Analysis.TokenStream,System.String)
member.summary: Highlights chosen terms in a text, extracting the most relevant section. The document text is analysed in chunks to record hit statistics across the document. After accumulating stats, the fragment with the highest score is returned
member.param: a stream of tokens identified in the text parameter, including offset information. This is typically produced by an analyzer re-parsing a document's text. Some work may be done on retrieving TokenStreams more efficently by adding support for storing original text position data in the Lucene index but this support is not currently available (as of Lucene 1.4 rc2).
member.returns: highlighted text fragment or null if no terms found

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Highlighter.GetBestFragments(Lucene.Net.Analysis.TokenStream,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Highlights chosen terms in a text, extracting the most relevant sections. The document text is analysed in chunks to record hit statistics across the document. After accumulating stats, the fragments with the highest scores are returned as an array of strings in order of score (contiguous fragments are merged into one in their original order to improve readability)
member.returns: highlighted text fragments (between 0 and maxNumFragments number of fragments)

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Highlighter.GetBestTextFragments(Lucene.Net.Analysis.TokenStream,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Low level api to get the most relevant (formatted) sections of the document. This method has been made public to allow visibility of score information held in TextFragment objects. Thanks to Jason Calabrese for help in redefining the interface.
member.param: if set to true this instance is merge contiguous fragments.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Highlighter.MergeContiguousFragments(Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.TextFragment[])
member.summary: Improves readability of a score-sorted list of TextFragments by merging any fragments that were contiguous in the original text into one larger fragment with the correct order. This will leave a "null" in the array entry for the lesser scored fragment.
member.param: An array of document fragments in descending score

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Highlighter.GetBestFragments(Lucene.Net.Analysis.TokenStream,System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Highlights terms in the text , extracting the most relevant sections and concatenating the chosen fragments with a separator (typically "..."). The document text is analysed in chunks to record hit statistics across the document. After accumulating stats, the fragments with the highest scores are returned in order as "separator" delimited strings.
member.param: the separator used to intersperse the document fragments (typically "...")

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Highlighter.GetMaxDocBytesToAnalyze
member.returns: the maximum number of bytes to be tokenized per doc

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Highlighter.SetMaxDocBytesToAnalyze(System.Int32)
member.param: the maximum number of bytes to be tokenized per doc (This can improve performance with large documents)

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Search.Highlight.Highlighter.GetFragmentScorer
member.returns: Object used to score each text fragment

At this stage in the page lifecycle, server controls in the hierarchy are created and initialized, view state is restored, and form controls reflect client-side data.
